RelatedSentence: INVESTMENT bank JPMorgan Cazenove has warned that unless South Africa 's platinum producers restructure the cheap - labour model , industrial strife will not abate and the industry will continue on a journey to self - destruction .

INVESTMENT bank JPMorgan Cazenove has warned that unless South Africa 's platinum producers restructure the cheap - labour model , industrial strife will not abate and the industry will continue on a journey to self - destruction .

Talks between the companies and the Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union ( Amcu ) have broken down over the union 's demand for a basic wage of R12,500 in four years , a 30 % annual wage increase that the companies can not afford .

While agreeing that the union 's wage demand is not affordable , JPMorgan Cazenove analysts Steve Shepherd , Allan Cooke and Abhishek Tiwari suggest that the only way out of the impasse was to remodel the labour - intensive industry in such a way that labour is more productive and therefore can be better paid , with a lesser risk of putting the mines out of business .

At today 's platinum prices , even current levels of remuneration are unaffordable for most mines , whose cash flows can barely cover the capital expenditure needed to continue mining , the report said .

A0: an in-depth report on the platinum industry published last week
RelatedSentence: At today 's platinum prices , even current levels of remuneration are unaffordable for most mines , whose cash flows can barely cover the capital expenditure needed to continue mining , the report said .

A0: an in-depth report on the platinum industry published last week
RelatedSentence: But the R12,500 wage demand was psychologically entrenched , the report said , and now that the workers ' aspiration genie was out of the bottle , it would not be wished away .
We foresee ongoing pressure for an unaffordable structural shift in wages and conditions of service for many years to come .

While many brokers ' reports have expressed the essential financial and economic problem of the industry in the same terms - that at present prices platinum can not generate enough cash to sustain operations into the future - none has seen the solution as requiring a new deal for labour .

The JPMorgan report considers mechanisation as a possible avenue out of South Africa 's labour problems but said this would not be feasible for the next 10 to 20 years .

RelatedSentence: Existing infrastructures and most ore bodies currently being tackled by this method are just not amenable to effective mechanisation , the report said .
Maintaining and operating the type of machinery required to implement mechanised mining on a wide scale could take years to implement efficiently .
Putting in place the required skills could take a decade or more even if the education system were mended .

RelatedSentence: Labour productivity improvements are therefore a more viable option and conceptually and practically possible , the report said .
Two options are suggested : well - conceived and material incentive bonus schemes for workers ; and shift arrangements that allow more shifts to be worked and assets to be sweated more effectively .
Past bonus schemes had not brought much improvement in productivity as management had adulterated them in response to pressure from labour .

But with a thin reef , the focus had to be on the reef package as most of the tonnage carried little value .

If shift arrangements were to be altered from the present five - day week to a six - day week system , in which workers rotated working five weeks on , followed by two weeks off , significant productivity improvements could be realised .
This would present 310 blasting cycle opportunities in a year as opposed to the current 276 .

An added advantage would be that migrant workers could spend two weeks out of every seven at home , creating more stable communities , However , innovative suggestions have not found their way into talks .
